object.name: Device.GRE.
object.description: This object contains parameters associated with the Generic Routing Encapsulation (GRE) Tunnel ({{bibref|RFC2784}}) with Key and Sequence Number extensions ({{bibref|RFC2890}}). This object also provides a means to treat packets that are encapsulated within a GRE Tunnel by using a set of {{object|Filter}} objects to determine the treatment of the packet.

parameter.name: TunnelNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: FilterNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.GRE.Tunnel.{i}.
object.description: GRE Tunnel table, models the GRE Tunnel instance and represents the entry point and exit point of the tunnel in relation to the WAN interface. A {{object}} object has one or more {{object|Interface}} objects that further define the sessions or flows within the tunnel.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the tunnel.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The current operational state of the tunnel.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: RemoteEndpoints
parameter.description: The Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) or IP address of the remote GRE tunnel endpoint. If more than one name/address is supplied, they will be tried in turn, i.e. they are in decreasing order of precedence.

parameter.name: KeepAlivePolicy
parameter.description: The mechanism used to keep the tunnel from timing out at the {{param|ConnectedRemoteEndpoint}}.

parameter.name: KeepAliveTimeout
parameter.description: The tunnel keepalive timeout in {{units}}.

parameter.name: KeepAliveThreshold
parameter.description: Number of KeepAlive messages unacknowledged by the {{param|ConnectedRemoteEndpoint}} before the {{object}} is perceived failed.

parameter.name: DeliveryHeaderProtocol
parameter.description: The protocol used for the delivery header.

parameter.name: DefaultDSCPMark
parameter.description: If the specified entries in the {{object|#.Filter}} table do not match this {{object}} object or an instance of the {{object|Interface}} object for this {{object}} object, then the value of this parameter is applied to the delivery header of the packets in this {{object}}.

parameter.name: ConnectedRemoteEndpoint
parameter.description: The Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) name or IP address of the connected remote GRE tunnel endpoint.

parameter.name: InterfaceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.GRE.Tunnel.{i}.Stats.
object.description:
Statistics for this GRE tunnel, i.e. all traffic that has passed through the tunnel.
The device MUST reset the tunnel's Stats parameters (unless otherwise stated in individual object or parameter descriptions) either when the tunnel becomes operationally down due to a previous administrative down (i.e., Status parameter transitions to a disabled state after the tunnel has been disabled) or when the tunnel becomes administratively up (i.e. the Enable parameter transitioned from {{false}} to {{true}}).

parameter.name: KeepAliveSent
parameter.description: The total number of KeepAlive {{units}} sent out the tunnel.

parameter.name: KeepAliveReceived
parameter.description: The total number of KeepAlive {{units}} received by the tunnel.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} sent by the tunnel.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received by the tunnel.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} sent by the tunnel.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received by the tunnel.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} discarded by the tunnel due to any error. This can include packets dropped due to a lack of transmit buffers.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received by the tunnel that contained errors preventing them from being delivered to a higher-layer protocol.

object.name: Device.GRE.Tunnel.{i}.Interface.{i}.
object.description: GRE Interface table (a stackable interface object as described in {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2}}). The {{object}} object models the GRE Header as defined in {{bibref|RFC2784}} and extensions to the GRE Header as defined in {{bibref|RFC2890}}. The {{object}} object provides a way to discriminate how sessions or flows are encapsulated within the GRE Tunnel. In addition the {{object}} object represents the entry point and exit point of the tunnel in relation to the LAN interface. Unless the Key Identifier of {{bibref|RFC2890}} is supported there is only one instance of this {{object}} object per tunnel.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description:
Enables or disables the interface.
This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description:
The current operational state of the interface (see {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.2}}). {{enum}}
When {{param|Enable}} is {{false}} then {{param}} SHOULD normally be {{enum|Down}} (or {{enum|NotPresent}} or {{enum|Error}} if there is a fault condition on the interface).
When {{param|Enable}} is changed to {{true}} then {{param}} SHOULD change to {{enum|Up}} if and only if the interface is able to transmit and receive network traffic; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Dormant}} if and only if the interface is operable but is waiting for external actions before it can transmit and receive network traffic (and subsequently change to {{enum|Up}} if still operable when the expected actions have completed); it SHOULD change to {{enum|LowerLayerDown}} if and only if the interface is prevented from entering the {{enum|Up}} state because one or more of the interfaces beneath it is down; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|Error}} state if there is an error or other fault condition detected on the interface; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|NotPresent}} state if the interface has missing (typically hardware) components; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Unknown}} if the state of the interface can not be determined for some reason.
This parameter is based on ''ifOperStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The textual name of the interface as assigned by the CPE.

parameter.name: LastChange
parameter.description: The accumulated time in {{units}} since the interface entered its current operational state.

parameter.name: LowerLayers
parameter.description: {{list}} {{reference|an interface object that is stacked immediately below this interface object}} See {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.1}}.

parameter.name: ProtocolIdOverride
parameter.description: The Protocol ID assigned to this {{object}}. The Protocol Id is the EtherType value used to identify the encapsulated payload. When set to {{null}} the CPE determines the Protocol Id.

parameter.name: UseChecksum
parameter.description: When {{true}}, includes the "Checksum" field in the GRE header as defined in {{bibref|RFC2784}}.

parameter.name: KeyIdentifierGenerationPolicy
parameter.description: The method used to generate the Key Identifier extension as defined in.{{bibref|RFC2890}}.

enumeration.description: The generation of the Key field is CPE specific implementation.

parameter.name: KeyIdentifier
parameter.description: When the value of {{param|KeyIdentifierGenerationPolicy}} is {{enum|Provisioned|KeyIdentifierGenerationPolicy}} this {{param}} parameter is used to identify an individual traffic flow within a GRE tunnel, as defined in {{bibref|RFC2890}}.

parameter.name: UseSequenceNumber
parameter.description: When {{true}}, includes the "SequenceNumber" field in the GRE header as defined in {{bibref|RFC2890}}

object.name: Device.GRE.Tunnel.{i}.Interface.{i}.Stats.
object.description:
Statistics for this GRE tunnel interface, i.e. all traffic that has passed through the interface.
The device MUST reset the interface's Stats parameters (unless otherwise stated in individual object or parameter descriptions) either when the interface becomes operationally down due to a previous administrative down (i.e., the interface's Status parameter transitions to a down state after the interface has been disabled) or when the interface becomes administratively up (i.e. the Enable parameter transitioned from {{false}} to {{true}}).

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} sent by this interface.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received by this interface.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} sent by this interface.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received by this interface.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} discarded by this interface due to any error. This can include packets dropped due to a lack of transmit buffers.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received by this interface that contained errors preventing them from being delivered to a higher-layer protocol.

parameter.name: DiscardChecksumReceived
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received by the tunnel interface that are discarded because of Checksum errors.

parameter.name: DiscardSequenceNumberReceived
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received by the tunnel interface that are discarded because of Sequence Number errors.

object.name: Device.GRE.Filter.{i}.
object.description:
GRE Filter table. Entries in this table are applied against the packets that are to be encapsulated within the GRE Tunnel based on the following conditions:
* If the value of the {{param|AllInterfaces}} is {{true}}, then this entry will be applied to all {{object|#.Tunnel}} and {{object|#.Tunnel.{i}.Interface}} instances.
* If the value of {{param|AllInterfaces}} is {{false}} and the value of {{param|Interface}} parameter is a reference to a row in the {{object|#.Tunnel}} table then this entry is applied to all {{object|#.Tunnel.{i}.Interface}} instances of the {{object|#.Tunnel}} reference.
* If the value of {{param|AllInterfaces}} is {{false}} and the value of {{param|Interface}} parameter is a reference to a row in the {{object|#.Tunnel.{i}.Interface}} table then this entry is applied to the {{object|#.Tunnel.{i}.Interface}} reference.
* If no entries are matched for the packet, then the default treatment (e.g., {{param|#.Tunnel.{i}.DefaultDSCPMark}}) is applied to the packet.
For enabled table entries, if {{param|Interface}} is not a valid reference and {{param|AllInterfaces}} is {{false}}, then the table entry is inoperable and the CPE MUST set {{param|Status}} to {{enum|Error_Misconfigured|Status}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this filter.

parameter.name: Status
Order
parameter.description:
Position of the {{object}} entry in the order of precedence. A value of ''1'' indicates the first entry considered (highest precedence). For each packet, the highest ordered entry that matches the filter criteria is applied. All lower order entries are ignored.
When this value is modified, if the value matches that of an existing entry, the {{param}} value for the existing entry and all lower {{param}} entries is incremented (lowered in precedence) to ensure uniqueness of this value. A deletion causes {{param}} values to be compacted. When a value is changed, incrementing occurs before compaction.
The value of {{param}} on creation of a {{object}} table entry MUST be one greater than the largest current value (initially assigned the lowest precedence).

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Interface
parameter.description: Filter criterion. {{reference}}

parameter.name: AllInterfaces
parameter.description: Filter criterion. This specifies that all ingress GRE tunnel interfaces are associated with the entry. If {{true}}, the value of {{param|Interface}} is ignored since all ingress GRE tunnel interfaces are indicated.

parameter.name: VLANIDCheck
parameter.description:
Filter criterion.
Current outer Ethernet VLAN ID as defined in 802.1Q. A value of -1 indicates this criterion is not used for filtering.

parameter.name: VLANIDExclude
parameter.description:
If {{false}}, the filter includes only those packets that match the {{param|VLANIDCheck}} entry, if specified.
If {{true}}, the filter includes all packets except those that match the {{param|VLANIDCheck}} entry, if specified.

parameter.name: DSCPMarkPolicy
parameter.description:
DSCP with which to mark the outer IP header for traffic that is associated with the interface criterion.
Automatic DSCP marking behavior is a local matter to the device, possibly influenced by other Broadband Forum standards that it supports.
* A value of -1 indicates copy from the upstream packet.
* A value of -2 indicates automatic marking of DSCP.
